natural problem:
Is the function $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ even, odd, or neither?

Enter "odd", "even", or "neither".

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - 5 powr (-x)"
shows  "odd f"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Is the function $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ even, odd, or neither?

Enter "odd", "even", or "neither". The final Answer is \text{odd}
 ### Proof
 Since \[f(-x) = 5^{-x} - 5^x = -f(x),\]the function $f(x)$ is $\boxed{\text{odd}}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - 5 powr (-x)"
shows  "odd f"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Determine whether the function $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ is odd.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - 5 powr (-x)"
shows  "\<forall> x. f (-x) = -f x"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Is the function $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ even, odd, or neither?

Enter "odd", "even", or "neither". The final Answer is \text{odd}
 ### Proof
 Since \[f(-x) = 5^{-x} - 5^x = -f(x),\]the function $f(x)$ is $\boxed{\text{odd}}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - 5 powr (-x)"
shows  "\<forall> x. f (-x) = -f x"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: For all real numbers $x$, if a function $f$ is defined such that $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$, show that $f(-x) = -f(x)$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - 5 powr (-x)"
shows  "\<forall> x. f x = - f (-x)"
a_2.formal solution:

theorem

 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: For any real-valued function $f$ defined by $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ for all real numbers $x$, show that $f(x) = -f(-x)$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 5 powr x - (1 / (5 powr x))"
shows  "odd f"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Is the function $f(x) = 5^x - 5^{-x}$ even, odd, or neither?

Enter "odd", "even", or "neither". The final Answer is \text{odd}

 proof-

a_9.informal problem: The function $f$ is defined by $f(x) = 5^x - \frac{1}{5^x}$ for all real numbers $x$. Prove that $f$ is an odd function.
